p: Antibiotic resistance is a worldwide problem which leads to high costs and deaths, mainly in the hospital context ( https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/en/healthcare-associated-infections-acute-care-hospitals/surveillance-disease-data/report, accessed on 12 March 2021). The antibacterial activity of natural products has been largely explored due to the growing antibiotic resistance noticed in several bacterial species [ 58, 59, 60, 61]. Camellia species have been highly explored over the years as a natural source of new compounds with antibiotic activity. Published studies evaluated the activity of several Camellia species ( C. sinensis, C. sinensis assamica, C. japonica, C. oleifera, Camellia reticulata, Camellia sasanqua and Camellia semiserrata) against Gram negative and Gram positive bacteria ( Table 2). The popular tea plant species was the most explored one and was reported as possessing activity against multiple bacteria.
